Tier 2 Antiquity Ranged Unit. Stronger on attack than defense.

Combat bonus when making an unobstructed attack from more than one tile away.
Unique Naval Unit. +4 Combat Strength on Coast. Has 1 charge to create a naval Trade Route.

Tier 3 Aksum Unique Naval Unit. +4 Combat Strength on Coast. Has 1 charge to create a naval Trade Route.
Aksum Unique Trade Ship. Cannot be pillaged. +10 Trade Route range.
Egyptian Unique Infantry Unit. Has no maintenance. +3 Combat Strength in friendly territory, doubled when stationed in a Settlement you own.

+1 Combat Strength for each City-State you are suzerain of.
Han Unique Ranged Unit. Has Zone of Control and a higher Defense Strength. +5 Combat Strength when attacking adjacent Units.
Tier 1 Han Unique Ranged Unit. Has Zone of Control and a higher Defense Strength. +5 Combat Strength when attacking adjacent Units.
Tier 2 Han Unique Ranged Unit. Has Zone of Control and a higher Defense Strength. +5 Combat Strength when attacking adjacent Units.
Khmer Unique Cavalry Unit. Higher Combat Strength, but slower Movement. Immune to flood damage. Ignores Zone of Control.
Tier 2 Khmer Unique Cavalry Unit. Higher Combat Strength, but slower Movement. Immune to flood damage. Ignores Zone of Control.
Tier 3 Khmer Unique Cavalry Unit. Higher Combat Strength, but slower Movement. Immune to flood damage. Ignores Zone of Control.
Khmer Unique Merchant. Civilian who can establish a Trade Route to import Resources from a foreign Settlement. Immune to flood damage. Ignores movement penalties from Wet Terrain.
Maurya Unique Cavalry Unit. +5 Combat Strength against Fortified Districts. Ignores Zone of Control.
Tier 2 Maurya Unique Cavalry Unit. +5 Combat Strength against Fortified Districts. Ignores Zone of Control.
Tier 3 Maurya Unique Cavalry Unit. +5 Combat Strength against Fortified Districts. Ignores Zone of Control.
Maurya Unique Settler. Civilian Unit capable of founding new Towns. Adds +2[icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS] Happiness on City Halls.
Maya Unique Ranged Unit. Can see through Vegetation and ignores movement penalties from Vegetated Terrain.
Tier 1 Maya Unique Ranged Unit. Can see through Vegetation and ignores movement penalties from Vegetated Terrain.
Tier 2 Maya Unique Ranged Unit. Can see through Vegetation and ignores movement penalties from Vegetated Terrain.

Maya Unique Scout. Can initiate combat. Has 1 charge to place a Jaguar Trap that is invisible to enemy Units, dealing 25 damage and ending movement. This ability recharges 5 turns after placing a trap.

Deals 25 damage to enemy Units that enter the tile and ends their movement. This removes the trap. Traps are invisible to all other Civilizations until triggered. Can be placed in unowned territory. Must be placed on Flat or Vegetated Terrain.
Mississippian Unique Ranged Unit. Increased Bombard Strength. +3 Combat Strength against Siege Units. Applies the Burning status to tiles for 2 turns.
Tier 1 Mississippian Unique Ranged Unit. Increased Bombard Strength. +3 Combat Strength against Siege Units. Applies the Burning status to tiles for 2 turns.
Tier 2 Mississippian Unique Ranged Unit. Increased Bombard Strength. +3 Combat Strength against Siege Units. Applies the Burning status to tiles for 2 turns.
Mississippian Unique Merchant. Civilian who can establish a Trade Route to import Resources from a foreign Settlement. Gain 25[icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold per Resource acquired when creating a Trade Route.
Persian Unique Infantry Unit. Heals 15 HP after defeating an enemy Unit.
Tier 2 Persian Unique Infantry Unit. Heals 15 HP after defeating an enemy Unit.
Tier 3 Persian Unique Infantry Unit. Heals 15 HP after defeating an enemy Unit.
Heals 15 HP after defeating an enemy Unit.
Persian Unique Army Commander. Starts with the Initiative Promotion.

Tier 3 Roman Unique Infantry Unit. +1 Combat Strength for every Tradition in the Government.

Roman Unique Army Commander. Gains 1 charge to create a new Settlement for every 3 Levels it has.
City-State Unique Infantry Unit. Up to 20% cheaper to purchase. Each one is slightly more expensive than the last. +2 Combat Strength for each adjacent Military Unit.
Tier 1 City-State Unique Infantry Unit. Up to 20% cheaper to purchase. Each one is slightly more expensive than the last. +2 Combat Strength for each adjacent Military Unit.
